recent_commits.info:
Fix vagrant issue: use exact version of bundler (#1355)

I was getting this error, ''Cant find gem bundler (>= 0.a) with
executable bundle', after I ran `vagrant up`. The version of RubyGem
installed in the vagrant box cannot find the exact version of Bundler
listed in Gemfile.lock. This solution ensures that the exact bundler
version installed in Gemfile.lock is installed before running `bundle
install`.

The issue is solved in RubyGems >= 2.7.10 and Ruby >=2.6.3. This
solution ensures a fix without requiring a more complicated upgrade.

More information found here: https://bundler.io/blog/2019/05/14/solutions-for-cant-find-gem-bundler-with-executable-bundle.html

recent_commits.info:
Dockerfile: allow Docker to cache build steps (#1336)

- By having a `COPY . xx` step before installing dependencies, we rob
Docker of the opportunity to cache downloading and building dependencies
if we make any changes to any files in the repository. By copying only
Gemfiles before the build step, we only require Docker to rebuild
dependencies when the Gemfiles have changed.

Co-authored-by: Matthew Peveler <matt.peveler@gmail.com>

other characters that are used in CSS notation. Those IDs can't be used
properly in a jQuery selector unless the special characters are escaped.

recent_commits.info:
Fix query cache enable/disable methods proxy on Rails5.x

The enable_query_cache! and disable_query_cache! methods are moved to
ConnectionProxy on Rails5.
Currently Octopus hijacks Connection's methods to turn on/off the
query cache for all shards, but should hook ConnectionProxy on Rails5.

This fixes issue that the query cache is shared beyond requests.
recent_commits.author: Tomoki Sekiyama

recent_commits.info:
Fix the bug that the any?, none?, one?, and many? methods are not executed on the shard

These methods are overridden by ActiveRecord::Relation so that they are
redirected to Enumerable if a block is given.
We should populate associated records from the specified shard before
these methods are called.
recent_commits.author: Tomoki Sekiyama

recent_commits.info:
Use __send__ method in ScopeProxy to avoid :send is passed to RelationProxy::method_missing

This makes enum method chain like `User.using(:brazil).all.each_with_index.to_a`
run on the shard as expected.

recent_commits.info:
Fix association shard tracking combined with enum method chain

Currently, when Enumerable methods that takes block are called for
relations taken from a shard, ActiveRecord::Relation object is
populated out of the shard, so the records from the master are used.

e.g.:

    User.using(:brazil).first.projects.where(id: ids).map(&:name)

will execute the query for `projects` on the `:master` shard,
instead of `:brazil`.

This patch lists up the Enumerable methods that are not redefined
by ActiveRecord classes, and redirect them to objects taken from
the correct shards.
recent_commits.author: Tomoki Sekiyama

recent_commits.info:
Document `--source-only` and add `--push-only`

The `--source-only` already works to only build and not deploy. But
sometimes we want to just push and not build. An example of that is
when you want to use Docker to build the project, avoiding the
installation of the whole Ruby environment in your computer.

This commit adds `--push-only` to add the ability to execute only the
actions related to `git` and avoid the project build.

No API was broken by this commit, it's a minor change.

recent_commits.info:
Raise helpful error if no slaves are available

Currently, if you run an Octopus-enabled application with a shards.yml that is misconfigured to define zero slaves in the appropriate slave group, you get this error:

```
<path_to_gems>/ar-octopus-0.9.0/lib/octopus/load_balancing/round_robin.rb:15:in `%': divided by 0 (ZeroDivisionError)
        from /home/ubuntu/quottly-ng/.bundle/ruby/2.3.0/gems/ar-octopus-0.9.0/lib/octopus/load_balancing/round_robin.rb:15:in `next'
        from /home/ubuntu/quottly-ng/.bundle/ruby/2.3.0/gems/ar-octopus-0.9.0/lib/octopus/proxy.rb:441:in `send_queries_to_selected_slave'
```
This isn't particularly hard to track down, but it could be more helpful.
recent_commits.author: James Gibson
